Posts.Content: kidsmom wrote: Hello all, I am finishing chemo after 3 more dd taxol.  I am awaiting genetic test results but also seriously contemplating double masectomy regardless of the results.  I am only 34 and my mother was diagnosed with BC at 57.  I had a lumpectomy with small 0.8 cm tumor, but two lymph nodes positive (both larger than original tumor).  I am scared about the chance of recurrance. Can some of you share your stories after lumpectomies? thank you Kidsmom Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How many have had recurrence after lumpectomy? kidsmom ozzie2

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2007 03:22AM kidsmom wrote: Thank you all for sharing your stories.  The reality that we don't know what the future brings really sucks, but it makes me appreciate everyday I have here. I worry about mets also because I originally felt a palpable lump in September 06.  The mammogram did not pick it up, but they did an ultrasound because they could feel it.  The ultrasound tech went and had the radiologist come look at me and he told me the lump was milk left over from me stopping breastfeeding my son 4 months earlier.  He said, nothing to worry about.  I was so realived knowing my mom had already had breast cancer.  He was WRONG!  By May of 07 I had a large painful lump under my left armpit which was more cancer from my original "milk lump"  which was of course also cancer.  So I definately am scared about what cancer may have escaped to the rest of my body during those 8 months.  I get my first CT scan post surgery this month.  There was a very small nodule on my lung in the original CT scan but the dr said it was too small to know if it was cancer and its common for people to have small non cancerous abnormalities.  I hope this DR is right. I am praying for all of you! Kidsmom
Posts.Title: How many have had recurrence after lumpectomy? kidsmom ozzie2
well my doctor called dmacw SandyInNJ63

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2007 01:38PM kidsmom wrote: trigeek, I have gained weight (about 5 lbs) during my 5 chemos and I'm sure its from all the bad food I've been eating.  For some reason, I feel justified eating junk because I did chemo and it sounds good.  Also, my mouth always has that metal taste so I think I'm looking for salty stuff to try and scape that taste away. Kidsmom

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2007 03:37PM kidsmom wrote: Mary Jo, This is a great question.  I've oftened wondered if my pain was from the AC or the neulesta.  I get my treatment of Friday and my shot on Monday.  Tuesday and Wednesday following are always my worst days.  I wake up Tuesday morning with my eyes feeling swollen and my head, neck and upper back are sore to the touch.  I figured this was neulasta.  I've tried motrin 800 and claritin D seperatly and haven't gotten relief from either.  By Friday the pain is gone but I still have the nasea from the treatment though.  I start Taxol this friday and am hoping somehow that it goes better. I hope your pain lessens and your treatment goes well too, Kidsmom
Posts.Title: is this Neulasta bone pain? bluewillow one_special_angel2006

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2007 06:31AM kidsmom wrote: I recently started taking Zoloft (25 mg/day). Has anybody had any experience with this. My doc says it isn't addictive and it should take the edge off. I was doing OK until we had a scare on my sister's mammogram right after my BC surgery. It appears she's OK, but is getting a second opinion anyway. I have never taken anxiety/depression medicine, but have just felt kind of overwhelmed so I hope the Zoloft helps.
